description: This is the interface description of @ObjectModel.
title: ObjectModel Document

@ObjectModel.compositionRoot.description: Entity is the root of a compositional hierarchy.
@ObjectModel.compositionRoot.title: @ObjectModel.compositionRoot

@ObjectModel.representativeKey.description: In case of multiple key elements: key element which represents the entity (in the sense that the entity itself is the list of values for this key element)
@ObjectModel.representativeKey.title: @ObjectModel.representativeKey

@ObjectModel.semanticKey.description: The entity contains element(s) which shall be used to display the key in UIs (instead of the technical key).
@ObjectModel.semanticKey.title: @ObjectModel.semanticKey

@ObjectModel.custom.description:
Indicates whether the annotated element or entity is a custom element.
If set to true, it is a custom element (field, entity, service, etc.).
If undefined or set to false, it is not defined whether it is a custom element.

If applied to an entity or service, everything that it contains is also considered custom.
@ObjectModel.custom.title: @ObjectModel.custom

@ObjectModel.modelingPattern.description: The property declares the modeling pattern applied in this entity definition.

#.description: Provide the value in `{ "#": "<value>" }` enum notation.

@ObjectModel.modelingPattern.title: @ObjectModel.modelingPattern

@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities.description: The property declares the supported usage type for this entity in the context of consuming data models.
@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities.title: @ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities

@ObjectModel.foreignKey.association.description:
The element is of type `cds.Association` which points to the list of values.

Use only for service internal associations. For cross service associations, use the [@EntityRelationship Vocabulary](./entity-relationship) instead.
@ObjectModel.foreignKey.association.title: @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association

@ObjectModel.text.element.description: The property contains element(s) containing a text for the annotated (id)element
@ObjectModel.text.element.title: @ObjectModel.text.element

@ObjectModel.text.association.description: The element is of type cds.association, which points to an entity containing (language-dependent) texts for the annotated (id) element
@ObjectModel.text.association.title: @ObjectModel.text.association

@ObjectModel.tenantWideUniqueName.description:
Unique technical name of the entity within the tenant / isolation context it is deployed to.
This may be used as a hint for database table names and help to keep them short enough.

Once chosen the technical name ID MUST be kept stable (immutable).
@ObjectModel.tenantWideUniqueName.title: @ObjectModel.tenantWideUniqueName

@ObjectModel.usageType.sizeCategory.description:
The size category enables the consumer to judge the possible result data set size.
It is a pure estimation at design time while modeling the entity what the data set size would be at runtime.
It reflects the set of data which has to be searched through to compute for example a count(*) of the data.

The labels correspond to the following size categories (expected number of rows at production customers):
- S: less than 1000
- M: less than 100.000
- L: less than 10.000.000
- XL: less than 100.000.000
- XXL: more than 100.000.000

#.description: Provide the value in `{ "#": "<value>" }` enum notation.

@ObjectModel.usageType.sizeCategory.title: @ObjectModel.usageType.sizeCategory

@ObjectModel.origin.description:
The annotation should be used to mark the fields and entities which are specific to some industries, 
localizations, partners or customers. This information can be evaluated by the clients reading CDS 
metadata from an ABAP Cloud system using CSN exposure API. The clients (like Business Data Cloud) 
can implement special handling of such fields and entities depending on their requirements.
@ObjectModel.origin.title: @ObjectModel.origin

layer.description:
The layer from which the annotated element or entity originates.
Examples are "INDUSTRY", "LOCALIZATION", "PARTNER", "CUSTOMER".

codes.description:
The codes specifying the origin within the given layer.
For example, for layer "LOCALIZATION" this could be a list of country codes like ["DE", "AT"].

#.description: The entry declares one supported usage type.
